{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Executive Secretary",
  "description": "Phillips Outsourcing Limited has been in existence for over 16 years. We have a vast experience in the outsourcing business as we currently manage resources for major clients in all sectors of the Nigerian economy. In addition, our prolific manpower cuts across the 36 states in Nigeria. After successfully gaining ground in all the 36 states of the federation, we are gradually spreading our tentacles to other African Nations. We are currently registered to also do business in Ghana. Our framework is developed to fully support the businesses of our clients, ensuring continuous improvement of the outsourced services. This ultimately thrusts our clients to achieve their business objectives.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Executive Secretary
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Industry: Banking

Responsibilities


	Act as a primary point of contact, screen and redirect phone calls, and handle all incoming and outgoing correspondence, including emails and letters.
	Make and confirm travel arrangements and organize logistics for events and meetings.
	Prepare, edit, and proofread correspondence, reports, and presentations. Maintain electronic and paper filing systems and ensure information is organized and accessible.
	Handle sensitive and confidential information with the utmost discretion and professionalism.
	Attend meetings, take minutes, and distribute them as needed.
	Act as a liaison between the executive and other staff, departments, and external clients to facilitate communication and maximize workflow.
	Conduct research, generate reports, assist with basic bookkeeping, and handle financial records or invoices.
	Maintain and organize the executive&#39;s daily, weekly, and monthly calendar, schedule appointments, and plan meetings and conferences.


Requirements


	Excellent verbal and written communication skills
	Strong time management and organizational abilities
	Proficiency in office management procedures and software
	Ability to multitask and work well under pressure
	High level of integrity and discretion
	Strong interpersonal skills
	Problem-solving skills.


Salary
N260,000 per month.&nbsp;",
  "datePosted": "2025-11-10",
  "validThrough": "2025-12-02",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Phillips OutSourcing"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Lagos",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "190146"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {

      "minValue": 250000,
      "maxValue": 400000,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }

}



Executive Secretary Job at Phillips Outsourcing Limited




        
    

        
        Phillips Outsourcing Limited has been in existence for over 16 years. We have a vast experience in the outsourcing business as we currently manage resources for major clients in all sectors of the Nigerian economy. In addition, our prolific manpower cuts across the 36 states in Nigeria. After successfully gaining ground in all the 36 states of the federation, we are gradually spreading our tentacles to other African Nations. We are currently registered to also do business in Ghana. Our framework is developed to fully support the businesses of our clients, ensuring continuous improvement of the outsourced services. This ultimately thrusts our clients to achieve their business objectives.
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Executive Secretary
Job Location: Lagos
Industry: Banking

Responsibilities


	Act as a primary point of contact, screen and redirect phone calls, and handle all incoming and outgoing correspondence, including emails and letters.
	Make and confirm travel arrangements and organize logistics for events and meetings.
	Prepare, edit, and proofread correspondence, reports, and presentations. Maintain electronic and paper filing systems and ensure information is organized and accessible.
	Handle sensitive and confidential information with the utmost discretion and professionalism.
	Attend meetings, take minutes, and distribute them as needed.
	Act as a liaison between the executive and other staff, departments, and external clients to facilitate communication and maximize workflow.
	Conduct research, generate reports, assist with basic bookkeeping, and handle financial records or invoices.
	Maintain and organize the executive's daily, weekly, and monthly calendar, schedule appointments, and plan meetings and conferences.


Requirements


	Excellent verbal and written communication skills
	Strong time management and organizational abilities
	Proficiency in office management procedures and software
	Ability to multitask and work well under pressure
	High level of integrity and discretion
	Strong interpersonal skills
	Problem-solving skills.


Salary
N260,000 per month.     

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     




        
        

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Operations and Sales Manager",
  "description": "Avocado Virtual Solutions (AVS) is a professional recruitment agency and business support service dedicated to helping entrepreneurs, small businesses, and busy professionals streamline their operations. We specialize in administrative support, customer service, social media management, recruitment assistance with onboarding, and business/company branding. Our mission is to help clients save time, enhance productivity, and build strong, recognizable brands while they focus on growing their businesses.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Operations and Sales Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Wuse Zone 4, Abuja (FCT)&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role


	We are looking for an organized,goal-driven and customer focused operations and sales manager to oversee the daily operations of a hair saloon.
	The ideal candidate will ensure smooth business activities,manage staff performance,drive sales and create an excellent customer experience that reflects our brand values


Responsibilities


	Supervise daily salon operations to ensure efficiency and excellent service delivery.
	Manage and motivate salon staff, including hairstylists, receptionists, and support staff.
	Develop and implement sales strategies to attract new clients and retain existing ones.
	Handle customer inquiries, complaints, and feedback professionally.
	Monitor inventory levels and coordinate supply orders when necessary.
	Prepare weekly and monthly sales and performance reports for management.
	Ensure the salon environment is clean, safe, and welcoming at all times.
	Create and manage promotions, discounts, and marketing activities to boost revenue.
	Maintain records of expenses, sales, and employee schedules.


Requirements


	OND / HND / Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or a related field.
	Minimum of 2 years of experience in sales, operations, or customer service (preferably in the beauty or hospitality industry).
	Strong leadership, communication, and organizational skills.
	Ability to multitask and work under minimal supervision.
	Good knowledge of social media marketing is an added advantage.


Salary
N130,000 - N150,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications to:&nbsp;avsabujacareer@gmail.com&nbsp;using &nbsp;&ldquo;Operations and Sales Manager&rdquo;&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

  "validThrough": "2025-11-18",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Avocado Virtual Solutions"
    
  },

    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",

Operations and Sales Manager Job at Avocado Virtual Solutions




        
    

        
        Avocado Virtual Solutions (AVS) is a professional recruitment agency and business support service dedicated to helping entrepreneurs, small businesses, and busy professionals streamline their operations. We specialize in administrative support, customer service, social media management, recruitment assistance with onboarding, and business/company branding. Our mission is to help clients save time, enhance productivity, and build strong, recognizable brands while they focus on growing their businesses.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Operations and Sales Manager

Job Location: Wuse Zone 4, Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are looking for an organized,goal-driven and customer focused operations and sales manager to oversee the daily operations of a hair saloon.
	The ideal candidate will ensure smooth business activities,manage staff performance,drive sales and create an excellent customer experience that reflects our brand values


Responsibilities


	Supervise daily salon operations to ensure efficiency and excellent service delivery.
	Manage and motivate salon staff, including hairstylists, receptionists, and support staff.
	Develop and implement sales strategies to attract new clients and retain existing ones.
	Handle customer inquiries, complaints, and feedback professionally.
	Monitor inventory levels and coordinate supply orders when necessary.
	Prepare weekly and monthly sales and performance reports for management.
	Ensure the salon environment is clean, safe, and welcoming at all times.
	Create and manage promotions, discounts, and marketing activities to boost revenue.
	Maintain records of expenses, sales, and employee schedules.


Requirements


	OND / HND / Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or a related field.
	Minimum of 2 years of experience in sales, operations, or customer service (preferably in the beauty or hospitality industry).
	Strong leadership, communication, and organizational skills.
	Ability to multitask and work under minimal supervision.
	Good knowledge of social media marketing is an added advantage.


Salary
N130,000 - N150,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications to: avsabujacareer@gmail.com using  “Operations and Sales Manager” using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Warehouse Assistant",
  "description": "Nemitt Pharmaceuticals Limited is an indigenous pharmaceutical company incorporated in July 1988 as a fully capitalized limited liability company with RC no 116 088 to among other activities, engage in the wholesale of Pharmaceutical products. Nemitt Pharmaceuticals Limited was born out of the dire need for an alternative to the hitherto existing chaotic distribution in the pharmaceutical supply chain. with the goal of addressing the gaps in the distribution value chain.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Warehouse Assistant

Job Location:&nbsp;Surulere, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a dedicated and organized Warehouse/ Store official to join our team.
	You will be responsible for managing inventory, overseeing stock levels, and ensuring the smooth operation of our store.
	The ideal candidate will have excellent organizational and problem-solving skills, attention to detail, satmina, and the ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment.


Job Description


	Replenish supply inventories following the established guidelines of the company
	Maintain a neat, clean, and safe working environment as per regulations
	Manage the store layout
	Receive, upload, and shelf supplies
	Perform stock-related duties like returning, packing, and labelling
	Inspect deliveries for discrepancies or damage
	Report damaged or short-dated inventories for record-keeping and reimbursement
	Rotate stock and dispose of surplus and expired quantities
	Keep an organised allocation of inventory placed in the warehouse and store
	Ensure proper completion of documentation of inbound and outbound orders.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess a minimum of ND, HND with 0 - 1 years of work experience.
	Must be organized and punctual.
	Prior experience in retail would be advantageous.
	Good verbal and written communication skills.
	Physical stamina and the ability to lift and move cartons
	Proficient in Microsoft Office.
	Proximity to Ojuelegba is very important ( Yaba, Surulere, Maryland, Onipan, Apapa, Ebute-metta, Anthony, etc).


Salary
N100,000 - N140,000 monthly.&nbsp;

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hrnemitt@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

Warehouse Assistant Job at Nemitt Pharmaceuticals Limited




        
    

        
        Nemitt Pharmaceuticals Limited is an indigenous pharmaceutical company incorporated in July 1988 as a fully capitalized limited liability company with RC no 116 088 to among other activities, engage in the wholesale of Pharmaceutical products. Nemitt Pharmaceuticals Limited was born out of the dire need for an alternative to the hitherto existing chaotic distribution in the pharmaceutical supply chain. with the goal of addressing the gaps in the distribution value chain.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Warehouse Assistant

Job Location: Surulere, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a dedicated and organized Warehouse/ Store official to join our team.
	You will be responsible for managing inventory, overseeing stock levels, and ensuring the smooth operation of our store.
	The ideal candidate will have excellent organizational and problem-solving skills, attention to detail, satmina, and the ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment.


Job Description


	Replenish supply inventories following the established guidelines of the company
	Maintain a neat, clean, and safe working environment as per regulations
	Manage the store layout
	Receive, upload, and shelf supplies
	Perform stock-related duties like returning, packing, and labelling
	Inspect deliveries for discrepancies or damage
	Report damaged or short-dated inventories for record-keeping and reimbursement
	Rotate stock and dispose of surplus and expired quantities
	Keep an organised allocation of inventory placed in the warehouse and store
	Ensure proper completion of documentation of inbound and outbound orders.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess a minimum of ND, HND with 0 - 1 years of work experience.
	Must be organized and punctual.
	Prior experience in retail would be advantageous.
	Good verbal and written communication skills.
	Physical stamina and the ability to lift and move cartons
	Proficient in Microsoft Office.
	Proximity to Ojuelegba is very important ( Yaba, Surulere, Maryland, Onipan, Apapa, Ebute-metta, Anthony, etc).


Salary
N100,000 - N140,000 monthly. 

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hrnemitt@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     




        
        

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

  "description": "Care Shield Pharmaceuticals is a community pharmacy that deals with drugs and other household products as well as other products.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Pharmacy Assistant

Job Location:&nbsp;Enugu

Job Summary


	The Pharmacy Assistant supports the pharmacist in the daily operations of the pharmacy.
	This includes assisting in dispensing medications, managing inventory, attending to customers, and ensuring the smooth running of the pharmacy.


Key Responsibilities


	Assist the pharmacist in preparing and dispensing prescription and over-the-counter medications.
	Attend to customer inquiries, providing guidance on medications and general health questions.
	Manage inventory, check expiry dates, and ensure proper storage of medications.
	Handle cash transactions and assist with billing processes.
	Maintain cleanliness and organization of the pharmacy.
	Record prescriptions, sales, and stock accurately.
	Support health awareness and patient education activities under the guidance of the pharmacist.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess an NCE / OND / HND qualification.
	Minimum of 1 year of experience in a pharmacy or retail setting.
	Good communication and customer service skills.
	Attention to detail, honesty, and ability to work in a team.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;Careshieldng@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Operations Safety Engineer",
  "description": "Benmaris Limited started as a professional manpower providers, financial consultants and general works contractor in 2007. It is a wholly owned Nigerian Company. Over the years, it has undertaken many challenging projects and accumulated skills, know-how and experiences in Facilities Management, Procurement and Supply Services, Design and Build Solutions, Project Management Services, Building Construction and related engineering works.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Operations Safety Engineer

Job Locations:&nbsp;Lagos
Job Type: Contract

About the Role


	Assists the DW FOPS Operations Safety Leader in the implementation of the Health, Safety and Environment standards &amp; objectives, in compliance with the One MAESTRO, COMPANY HSE Management System and other COMPANY E&amp;P Referential.
	Support the DW FOPS OSL to actively lead Company HSE awareness and initiative schemes, ensure compliance with/application of all relevant statutory and Company HSE standards on the operational sites
	In liaison with the DW FOPS OSL, act as a focal point for all HSE statistics reporting relating to DW Field Operations onshore and offshore activities weekly (Collates for review anomaly reports issued from DW Onshore and record/trend incident reports from DW Offshore)
	Ensure HSE training requirements for all DWA FOPS personnel (staff and contract) are completely captured in SafePass, HSEPass and ePOB as the case may be; then monitor to drive compliance and report HSE training performance weekly.
	Stand down review of Incident/REX notifications and their Synergi cases, then follow up the implementation of all DW FOPS actions in Synergi arising from incident investigation reports, audits implementation, etc.
	Assist the DW FOPS OSL in preparation of reports on key HSE events and related DW FOPS activities (FORUM, CODIV, STANDOWN, AWAY-DAY, etc), then monitor DW Field Operations HSE Performances (objectives, activity plan, KPI)
	Develop DW FOPS monthly HSE Performance reports following the direction of the DW FOPS OSL and assist in the preparation, coordination and organization of the quarterly base HSE Committee Meetings (CODIV)
	Facilitate and participate in contractors HSE MS audits; operational sites HSE audits &amp; inspections as well as report, monitor and update all actions emanating from them, including OPERSAFE and MAESTRO Audit corrective actions
	Participate in hazard studies / risk assessments undertaken for the modification of installations and the execution of operations when the need arises to ensure the safe execution of operations; and that risks are adequately managed
	Create new HSE material/equipment after validating the specifications with DW FOPS OSL, raise MRFs/SRF for procurement of HSE consumables /services for site operations; follow up with responsible supply chain parties (buyer, FOPS materials coordinator, transit, Stock controller, LADOL materials Supt, etc) till delivery to site.
	Monitor as the Decentralized Purchase Person the HSE consumables and services supply chain processes for unassigned PRs, unreleased PRs, POs, and SES; then promptly highlight to the DWA FOPS OSL for intervention. Participate in the supply chain DUET meetings to drive availability of HSE consumable materials.
	Lead specific Operations Safety reviews in support of Request for Modification (RFM) process and Downgraded Situations (DGS) &ndash; HAZOP, HAZID, etc.
	Support operational entities in Call-For-Tender Risk Assessment and Derogation preparation.
	Transverse follow up of HSE budget executors to ensure work plans are adequately captured in the IOP plan; work scope executed as plan and the invoices submitted in a timely manner for all scope executed
	Contribute to development of REX from event/activity reports; distribution of REX (HSE alerts, FBN, SFN) and follow up implementation of REX recommendations
	Follow up of the implementation of the DW FOPS HSEQ activity plan in line with the HSEQ objectives set for the year to ensure adequate monitoring, regular update and effective communication of the HSEQ activities.
	Participate in the review of key operational HSE document (SIMOPS/HSE Dossiers, specific procedures, bridging document, etc.)
	Coordinate and deliver (where required) identified HSE training needs of existing asset personnel and follow up their HSE training compliance (company and contractor); also support the DW FOPS OSL in providing relevant HSE awareness sessions to new persons arriving the division.


Requirements


	Engineering degree in Civil, Electrical, Mechanical, Petroleum or Safety, fluent in English with good communication skills
	Professional Experience: 5 years in Oil and Gas (E&amp;P), 3 years in HSE position.
	Experience in a construction and operation environment, in Safety Engineering techniques, (HAZOP, PTR, HAZID and Audits)
",
  "datePosted": "2025-11-10",
  "validThrough": "2025-11-12",
  "employmentType": "Contract",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Benmaris Limited"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Lagos",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "190142"
  },

    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Operations Safety Engineer Job at Benmaris Limited




        
    

        
        Benmaris Limited started as a professional manpower providers, financial consultants and general works contractor in 2007. It is a wholly owned Nigerian Company. Over the years, it has undertaken many challenging projects and accumulated skills, know-how and experiences in Facilities Management, Procurement and Supply Services, Design and Build Solutions, Project Management Services, Building Construction and related engineering works.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Operations Safety Engineer

Job Locations: Lagos
Job Type: Contract

About the Role
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Assists the DW FOPS Operations Safety Leader in the implementation of the Health, Safety and Environment standards & objectives, in compliance with the One MAESTRO, COMPANY HSE Management System and other COMPANY E&P Referential.
	Support the DW FOPS OSL to actively lead Company HSE awareness and initiative schemes, ensure compliance with/application of all relevant statutory and Company HSE standards on the operational sites
	In liaison with the DW FOPS OSL, act as a focal point for all HSE statistics reporting relating to DW Field Operations onshore and offshore activities weekly (Collates for review anomaly reports issued from DW Onshore and record/trend incident reports from DW Offshore)
	Ensure HSE training requirements for all DWA FOPS personnel (staff and contract) are completely captured in SafePass, HSEPass and ePOB as the case may be; then monitor to drive compliance and report HSE training performance weekly.
	Stand down review of Incident/REX notifications and their Synergi cases, then follow up the implementation of all DW FOPS actions in Synergi arising from incident investigation reports, audits implementation, etc.
	Assist the DW FOPS OSL in preparation of reports on key HSE events and related DW FOPS activities (FORUM, CODIV, STANDOWN, AWAY-DAY, etc), then monitor DW Field Operations HSE Performances (objectives, activity plan, KPI)
	Develop DW FOPS monthly HSE Performance reports following the direction of the DW FOPS OSL and assist in the preparation, coordination and organization of the quarterly base HSE Committee Meetings (CODIV)
	Facilitate and participate in contractors HSE MS audits; operational sites HSE audits & inspections as well as report, monitor and update all actions emanating from them, including OPERSAFE and MAESTRO Audit corrective actions
	Participate in hazard studies / risk assessments undertaken for the modification of installations and the execution of operations when the need arises to ensure the safe execution of operations; and that risks are adequately managed
	Create new HSE material/equipment after validating the specifications with DW FOPS OSL, raise MRFs/SRF for procurement of HSE consumables /services for site operations; follow up with responsible supply chain parties (buyer, FOPS materials coordinator, transit, Stock controller, LADOL materials Supt, etc) till delivery to site.
	Monitor as the Decentralized Purchase Person the HSE consumables and services supply chain processes for unassigned PRs, unreleased PRs, POs, and SES; then promptly highlight to the DWA FOPS OSL for intervention. Participate in the supply chain DUET meetings to drive availability of HSE consumable materials.
	Lead specific Operations Safety reviews in support of Request for Modification (RFM) process and Downgraded Situations (DGS) – HAZOP, HAZID, etc.
	Support operational entities in Call-For-Tender Risk Assessment and Derogation preparation.
	Transverse follow up of HSE budget executors to ensure work plans are adequately captured in the IOP plan; work scope executed as plan and the invoices submitted in a timely manner for all scope executed
	Contribute to development of REX from event/activity reports; distribution of REX (HSE alerts, FBN, SFN) and follow up implementation of REX recommendations
	Follow up of the implementation of the DW FOPS HSEQ activity plan in line with the HSEQ objectives set for the year to ensure adequate monitoring, regular update and effective communication of the HSEQ activities.
	Participate in the review of key operational HSE document (SIMOPS/HSE Dossiers, specific procedures, bridging document, etc.)
	Coordinate and deliver (where required) identified HSE training needs of existing asset personnel and follow up their HSE training compliance (company and contractor); also support the DW FOPS OSL in providing relevant HSE awareness sessions to new persons arriving the division.


Requirements


	Engineering degree in Civil, Electrical, Mechanical, Petroleum or Safety, fluent in English with good communication skills
	Professional Experience: 5 years in Oil and Gas (E&P), 3 years in HSE position.
	Experience in a construction and operation environment, in Safety Engineering techniques, (HAZOP, PTR, HAZID and Audits)
